newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk police arrest three for smuggling heavy metal.
newsitem.headline: Turk police arrest three for smuggling heavy metal.

text.p: Turkish police said on Tuesday they had arrested three men for smuggling a radioactive and highly valuable heavy metal used in the nuclear industry.
"As a result of intelligence work by our officers (the men) were arrested trying to sell the material Osmium which they had brought from Romania," a police statement said.

The three men were arrested in Istanbul by police posing as potential buyers. Police agreed a price of $500,000 for the metal and later met the men in an Istanbul tea shop where they carried out the arrests.
The smuggling of radioactive materials from eastern Europe has surged since the fall of communism, but such cases have so far been rare in Turkey.
